title: Intel is in crisis but still planning GPUs
excerpt: Intel has expanded its product line to include dedicated GPUs through its Arc series, competing with NVIDIA and AMD.
content:
## Intel and the GPU Gamble

Intel is facing one of the toughest periods in its history, yet it continues to invest heavily in **dedicated GPUs** through its Arc lineup.

### Why Intel Entered GPUs

- Reduce dependency on CPUs
- Compete with NVIDIA and AMD
- Push AV1 and AI workloads

```js
const arcGpu = "Intel Arc A770";
console.log(`GPU: ${arcGpu}`);
```

### The Road Ahead

While driver stability remains a challenge, Intel’s long-term vision could reshape the GPU market if executed correctly.

title: AMD has reportedly sold nearly 200K RX 9070 GPUs worldwide
excerpt: AMD’s RX 9070 GPUs are nearly sold out worldwide amid Nvidia shortages.
content:
## AMD Capitalizes on Nvidia Shortages

AMD has reportedly sold **nearly 200,000 RX 9070 GPUs**, benefiting from severe stock shortages across Nvidia’s RTX lineup.

### What Changed?

- Better availability
- Competitive pricing
- Strong raster performance

```bash
$ lspci | grep VGA
AMD Radeon RX 9070 XT
```

### Market Impact

This surge could allow AMD to reclaim significant market share if supply remains stable.

title: U.S. allows TSMC to import chipmaking equipment into China
excerpt: The U.S. has granted TSMC limited approval to import chipmaking equipment into China-based fabs.
content:
## Semiconductor Politics

The U.S. government has granted **TSMC special permissions** to continue importing certain chipmaking equipment into its China fabs.

### Why This Matters

- Keeps mature-node fabs running
- Balances geopolitics and supply chains

### Key Constraints

- No EUV machines
- Advanced nodes restricted

This decision highlights how fragile the global semiconductor ecosystem has become.

title: Why Modern CPUs Rely So Heavily on Cache
excerpt: CPU cache design has become more important than raw clock speeds.
content:
## The Cache Revolution

Modern CPUs are no longer defined by GHz alone.

### Types of Cache

- L1: fastest, smallest
- L2: balanced
- L3: shared across cores

```c
int sum(int a, int b) {
  return a + b;
}
```

### Why Cache Wins

Memory latency is the true bottleneck in modern systems.

title: The Rise of AV1: Why Video Encoding Is Changing
excerpt: AV1 is reshaping video streaming and content creation.
content:
## Goodbye H.264?

AV1 is rapidly becoming the preferred codec for modern platforms.

### Benefits

- Better compression
- Royalty-free
- Hardware acceleration

### Adoption

YouTube, Netflix, and GPUs from Intel and AMD already support AV1.
